stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains why the code segment does not work as intended?

features.html:
Consider the following class definition.

 

public class Item
{
   private double price;

   public Item(double price)
   {
      price = price;
   }

   public double getPrice()
   {
      return price;
   }

   /* There are no other instance variables,
      methods, or constructors. */
}

 

The following code segment appears in a class other than  Item.  The code segment is intended to print the value  2.0  but does not work as intended.
 

Item pen = new Item(2.0);
System.out.println(pen.getPrice());

choicesHtml: The code segment does not compile because the call to the  Item  constructor uses incorrect syntax.
The  Item  class does not compile because the  getPrice  method does not have access to a variable named  price.
The instance variable  price  is not assigned a value in the  Item  constructor because the constructor does not return a value.
The instance variable  price  is not assigned a value in the  Item  constructor because the constructor assigns a value to the parameter instead of the instance variable.
